alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Morgan; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 5:08PM CST until February 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell, Morgan and Scott. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated at least a half inch of rain has fallen upon already wet soils, and more rain is expected this evening. Minor flooding is possible in the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Oneida, Huntsville, Helenwood, Jellico, Caryville, Winfield, Sunbright, Robbins, Slick Rock, Norma, Elgin, Honey Creek State Park, Big South Fork National Park, Rugby, Rugby State Park, Royal Blue, Ketchen, Elk Valley, Frozen Head State Park and Deerlodge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
